title: NastyWork Club Marketing Promotional Tour, Toronto
description: We’re hosting a conference bringing together critics of techno-feudalism—scholars, journalists, and activists concerned with digital monopolies and algorithmic control. We’re looking for a freelancer to design and run a multi-channel marketing campaign that will highlight the urgency of these discussions and drive registrations. The ideal partner will help us position the event as both intellectually rigorous and culturally relevant.

milestones.title: Phase 1 – Positioning & Messaging
milestones.description: Work with our team to craft a strong narrative framework that captures the stakes of techno-feudalism, and produce brand assets, talking points, and media kits to set the tone for promotion.

milestones.title: Phase 2 – Outreach & Campaign Rollout
milestones.description: Execute a campaign across social, newsletters, and media outlets; build partnerships with aligned organizations; and spotlight key speakers through content drops and teasers to drive early RSVPs.

milestones.title: Phase 3 – Event Amplification & Legacy
milestones.description: Support live event coverage (social media, video recaps, media outreach) and produce a post-event package—such as a highlight reel or digital archive—that keeps the conversation alive beyond the conference itself.
